member.name: T:EPiServer.Commerce.ApplicationContext
member.summary: Contains information about the current application context

member.name: P:EPiServer.Commerce.ApplicationContext.HasContentModelTypes
member.summary: Indicates whether the current application has the IContent model types for catalog content available. Considers the models available if there is at least one available which is decorated with the .

member.name: P:EPiServer.Commerce.ApplicationContext.SkipContentModelCheck
member.summary: Gets the episerver:SkipCatalogContentModelCheck appSetting, indicating wheter the value returned by should be ignored. Setting this to true means operations that require the content models for catalog content are considered safe even if there are no classes decorated with . This is useful for sites that don't use typed models.
member.remarks: The appSetting should under no circumstances be used in applications that share a database with an application which HAS content type models, e.g. in the Commerce Manager application.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Commerce.ApplicationContext.DisableVersionSync
member.summary: Gets the value of the DisableVersionSync appSetting, indicating whether an update to Catalog content done outside the Content APIs will remove any version data (e.g. drafts, old published versions...) for the affected Content. Setting this to true can improve the speed of batch operations done through the lower-level API:s (like ICatalogSystem), e.g. the catalog import.
member.value: true to delete all versions; false to update versions if content models are available.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Commerce.Catalog.Internal.CatalogLanguageSettingsResolver
member.summary:
This type/member supports the EPiServer infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Extends the default language settings resolver with logic for catalog content. The logic is as follows: - No replacement languages - No fallback languages - All languages that are enabled for a catalog are active, the others are not.

member.summary: Gets the settings for all languages for the specified content link.
member.returns: An IEnumerable{ContentLanguageSetting} with the language settings for the given content.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Commerce.Catalog.CatalogSecurityDescriptor
member.summary: Handles access rights for catalog content.
member.remarks: The logic is as follows: - All users has read access to all content. - Users allowed access to the catalog management UI, ie they are in the role or , have full access to all content. - Users allowed acesss to the Commerce Settings UI, ie they are in the role , have full access to all Settings.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Commerce.Catalog.Linking.IRelationRepository.GetRelationsBySource(EPiServer.Core.ContentReference)
member.summary: Gets the relations with matching the specified content link. Depending on what content type the specified content link points to this will return instances of one or more of the following relation types: where Target is a product variation. or where Target is a bundle/package entry. where Target is a (parent) category.
member.param: The source content link to match.
member.returns: The matching relations.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Commerce.Catalog.Linking.IRelationRepository.GetRelationsBySource``1(EPiServer.Core.ContentReference)
member.summary: Gets the relations with matching the specified content link. Depending on what content type the specified content link points to this will return instances of one or more of the following relation types: where Target is a product variation. or where Target is a bundle/package entry. where Target is a (parent) category.
member.typeparam: The type of relation to filter by, e.g. return only instances.
member.param: The source content link to match.
member.returns: The matching relations.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Commerce.Catalog.Linking.IRelationRepository.GetRelationsByTarget(EPiServer.Core.ContentReference)
member.summary: Gets the relations with matching the speified content link. Depending on what content type the specified content link points to this will return instances of one or more of the following relation types: where Source is the parent product of the variation. or where Source is a bundle/package containing the entry. where Source is an entry or (sub) category in the specified category. However, that information is probably simpler to retrieve by using s GetChildren method.
member.param: The target content link to match.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Commerce.Catalog.Linking.IRelationRepository.GetRelationsByTarget``1(EPiServer.Core.ContentReference)
member.summary: Gets the relations with matching the speified content link. Depending on what content type the specified content link points to this will return instances of one or more of the following relation types: where Source is the parent product of the variation. or where Source is a bundle/package containing the entry. where Source is an entry or (sub) category in the specified category. However, that information is probably simpler to retrieve by using s GetChildren method.
member.typeparam: The type of relation to filter by, e.g. return only instances.
member.param: The target content link to match.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.AffectedEntries
member.summary: Used for handling redemption calculations on entry promotions.
member.remarks:
An example of typical usage of this class:
You have a "Buy 3 pay for 2" type of discount. The AffectedEntries would be filled with a quantity of three (corresponding to the "Buy 3" part), and you would call SetDiscountRange with parameters 2, 1 to indicate that the discount would be applied to the last item (skip 2 and apply to the final single quantity).
Note that setting a discount range and iterating over that range might mean that the configuration of the underlying list might change, since individual price entries might be split to support the requests. There is even support for having fractional quantities.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.AffectedEntries.ForEachCode``1(System.Func{EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.PriceEntry,``0,``0})
member.summary: Enumerates over all entries in the current discount range and performs calculation per entry code.
member.typeparam: The resulting type of the calculation, usually decimal if summing up values.
member.param: The actual calculation to perform. Takes a and an accumulator and returns the accumulator together with the new value.
member.returns: A Dictionary that contains the code as key and the final result of the calculation as value.
member.remarks: Note that the iteration is done over the current discount range, which is usually the only interesting part. If you need to iterate over the entire range of entries, reset by calling SetDiscountRange(0, 0).

member.name: M:EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.PriceEntry.Split(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Split this into two.
member.param: The quantity to move to the new entry.
member.returns: A new with Quantity set to .
member.remarks:
The original entry will have its quantity reduced by the requestedQuantity. If the original entry has rounding error adjustments in ActualTotal, these adjustments will be retained across the two entries.
Note that merging (with an entry that has been split (no other modifications), will re-create the exact same PriceEntry as before the split.

member.param: The PriceEntry to merge from. Should be discarded after a merge.
member.returns: True if the merge was successful, False otherwise.
member.remarks: In order for the merge to succeed, both entries must share the same ParentItem and have the same price.

member.summary: Evaluates a promotion against an order form. Implementations should use context.OrderForm for evaluations.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.PromotionProcessorBase`1.CanBeFulfilled(`0,EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.PromotionProcessorContext)
member.summary: Verify that the current promotion can potentially be fulfilled
member.remarks: This method is intended to be a very quick pre-check to avoid doing more expensive operations. Used to verify basic things, for example a Buy-3-pay-for-2 promotion needs at least three items in the cart. If we have less than three we can skip further processing.
member.param: The context for the promotion processor evaluation.
member.returns: true if the current promotion can potentially be fulfilled; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets a string representation of the member expressions in an expressions body possibly containing multiple levels. Example: Type A has a property TheB of type B which has a property TheC of any type. GetFullPropertyName<A>(a => a.TheB.TheC) returns {"TheB", "TheC"}.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Commerce.Routing.Internal.CachingUrlResolver.GetVirtualPath(EPiServer.Core.ContentReference,System.String,EPiServer.Web.Routing.VirtualPathArguments)
member.summary: Tries to get the URL for a content and mode and returns a that contains the routing information. Uses the HttpContext, if available, as a per-request cache.
member.para: The returned value is always a relative path (host and application is not included), call extension method GetUrl on VirtualPathData to get an absolute path (there is an overload that can be used if authority part should not be included).
member.returns: A virtual path or null if it was not possible to create a route to the content (for example the content does not exist or has no template)

member.summary: Class used for serializing and deserializing a object. Defines new properties shadowing the old read-only properties. Using the original class as base class to get some kind of connection which will get some early errors if the base class is changed. However, the base class uses a DataContract attribute which prevents the properties from being serialized since they dont have a DataMember attributes which is why they are added here instead.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Business.Commerce.VirtualPathProviders.AssetFileStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.exception: The sum of offset and count is larger than the buffer length.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.
The stream does not support reading.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Business.Commerce.VirtualPathProviders.AssetFileStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.
member.returns: The unsigned byte cast to an Int32, or -1 if at the end of the stream.
member.exception: The stream does not support reading.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Business.Commerce.VirtualPathProviders.AssetFileStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the origin parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.
member.exception: The stream does not support seeking, such as if the stream is constructed from a pipe or console output.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Business.Commerce.VirtualPathProviders.AssetFileStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the length of the current stream.
member.param: The desired length of the current stream in bytes.
member.exception: The stream does not support both writing and seeking, such as if the stream is constructed from a pipe or console output.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Business.Commerce.VirtualPathProviders.AssetFileStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies count bytes from buffer to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.
member.exception: The stream does not support writing.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.
The sum of offset and count is greater than the buffer length.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Business.Commerce.VirtualPathProviders.AssetFileStream.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte to the current position in the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte.
member.param: The byte to write to the stream.
member.exception: Methods were called after the stream was closed.
The stream does not support writing, or the stream is already closed.
